tool.name: Digest
tool.description: Theoretically digest all protein sequences from a FASTA file by trypsin

param.name: miscleavage
param.label: the number of maximum allowed miscleavage

param.name: minLength
param.label: the minimum length for the digested peptides to be included in the result file

param.name: maxLength
param.label: the maximum length for the digested peptides to be included in the result file

param.name: unique
param.label: Remove identical peptides?
param.help: Based on the fact that duplicate peptides cannot uniquely identify one particular protein, the Yes option will remove all duplicates and the No option will keep only one peptide copy. Note this option only applies when the output format is fasta

param.name: out_type
param.label: The output file format
param.help: The format of the output file

tool.help: This tool digests protein sequences theoretically by trypsin and outputs into either TSV or Fasta format. In TSV format, the first column is the protein accession before the first whitespace and the second column is the tryptic peptids. In Fasta format, the digested peptides form individual entries with the headers in the form of <protein>-mis<miscleavage_number>-pep<peptide_number>. The additional filters for peptide length and proteotypic peptides are useful for SRM (Selected Reaction Monitoring) to filter out the peptides won't be observed on a specific MS/MS instrument.
